src.model.utils.heatmap_image module¶

Credits to Professor Brian R. King, Bucknell University

class src.model.utils.heatmap_image.HeatmapImage(dim, colormap)¶

Bases: object

overlay_heatmap_on_axes(ax: matplotlib.axes._axes.Axes, min_color_val=0.5, max_color_val=10, sigma=5, alpha=0.6) → None¶

Overlay the heatmap on a specified set of Axes :param ax: Axes object to overlap heatmap on :param min_color_val: Minimum value in heatmap to map to the coolest color. To allow everything to be displayed, set to 0.5. Higher is more restrictive. :param max_color_val: Maximum value in heatmap to be the “hottest” color :param sigma: Value passed to ndimage.gaussian_filter to blur :param alpha: amount of alpha blending = default = 0.6

update_heatmap_array_with_trial(trial, radius=3)¶

This function updates the heatmap image with data from a trial :param trial: Trial data to plot for the heatmap :param radius: the size of each point to be placed on the heatmap :return:
